result.execSummary:
The defendant Faith H Poppele was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Repeater enhancer on Ct. 3 Dismissed but read in.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit DNA sample.  AODA and comply.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.

Defendant Faith H Poppele in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest to Ct. 3. with repeater enhancer dismissed but read in.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Cts. 1 & 2 Dismissed but read in.  On Ct. 1 Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 1 year.  Conditions of probation include: $443.00 costs.  AODA and comply.  Submit DNA sample.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
